resources.string: Hooks to enable setting the SIM phone number

SIM Number Setter writes a given phone number to your SIM card's "subscriber number" memory. This is the number Android reads and uses in a few places throughout the system, including Settings and Messages. It is also provided to some third party apps, if they have sufficient permissions.

Changing the SIM number is semi-permanent: the number change will survive reboots, uninstalling this app, even switching the SIM to a different device, but can be changed again at any time using this app.

SIM Number Setter does NOT:
- Change your actual phone number, no matter what you enter.
- Unblock a network blocked SIM.
- Give you free data or calls.
- Change your IMEI.

SIM Number Setter uses the built-in Android methods to write data to the SIM. The app nor the developer are not responsible for issues with the process, including any damage to the SIM or network issues.
Your device is not rooted, or root was denied. Root is required for this app to work.
Failed to grant permissions using root, please restart the app and try again.
Failed to connect to the Xposed service, make sure the module is enabled and you have rebooted.
Failed to save number, your device does not support this feature, sorry.
